page.title: 07Riverside Centre.
page.content: Riverside is a centre for boys and girls who have been sent there for breaking the law or for example not attending school and are in the care of the County Council. The centre is divided into 3 parts. There is a community home school for 40 boys and l0 girls. The children must stay at school at night. The observation\ assessment centre has l5 boys and 5 girls and the intermediate treatment centre has 6 pupils. There are 80 staff who care for the children, teach and train them up to the age of l6 in various skills as well as academic lessons. They play sport and play home and away matches. They have an army cadet force which has its own assault course. The usual stay at the centre is for 3-4 months, but they are allowed to go home for weekends if their behaviour has been exemplary.
